page.title: 12 WOODSIDE PARK ESTATE
page.content: Opposite Bysingwood school used to be a field where horses ran.Last year it was sold to Barratts housing and they began to build houses using their timber-frame construction method. Following a T.V. programme that suggested that this type of house suffered from condensation as the building dries out,they found that they could not sell the houses and phase 2 was postponed.Barratts,Britain's largest builders have now called a halt to this multi-million pound development and sold out to a Kent building firm. They are planing a new site in Maidstone using the more traditional building methods.Barratts maintain that Faversham is ideally situated for a housing developement of the size and type originally planned for Woodside park and plan to build similar houses in Scotland.
